value.title: Fuzzy match / merging in Power BI Desktop (October 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the new fuzzy match / merging option within the October 2018 version of Power BI Desktop. This feature is incredibly powerful when it comes to data matching and can be adjusted to meet your needs.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Automatic refresh in Power BI desktop - Power BI desktop update October 2019
value.excerpt: In the october power bi desktop update, they released the possibility to have automatic page refresh for direct queries in power bi desktop and the service too. Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, youâ€™ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: #33 Import from PDF into Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to import data from a pdf file into Power BI using Imke Feldmann's R-script.  To download the file, go to Curbal's download center and the communty downloads and get gile #33: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  Install R in Power BI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcTdXgWGdS8
